sentence.text: Recently, autosomal recessive loss-of-function mutations in keratinocyte development (encoding exophilin-5, also known as keratinocyte development, a protein involved in intracellular vesicle transport) were identified in a new mechanobullous disease resembling a form of epidermolysis bullosa simplex (EBS).

Here, we searched for mutations in keratinocyte development in a 4-year-old white boy with EBS in whom initial Sanger sequencing of known genes implicated in intraepidermal skin fragility failed to identify pathogenic mutations.
This case represents the third pedigree with keratinocyte development mutations resulting in inherited skin fragility.
